Pre-Game Insights: Burkina Faso host Malawi on Sunday in the Africa Cup of Nations qualifiers, with both teams seeking a crucial win following their opening results in the campaign.
Burkina Faso’s Defensive Struggles: Burkina Faso have failed to keep a clean sheet in their last eight matches across all competitions.
Malawi’s Attacking Threat: Malawi have averaged two goals per game in AFCON qualifying so far.
Head-to-Head Dominance: Burkina Faso have won four of their last six encounters with Malawi.
Burkina Faso will host Malawi in Bamako, Mali, due to a lack of a suitable venue in their home country.
Burkina Faso secured a hard-fought 1-1 draw against Senegal, while Malawi were left ruing a 3-2 defeat at home to Burundi.
